<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 277, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 904, 292]]<|/det|>
9709/31  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 301, 309, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 3 Pure Mathematics 3  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[770, 302, 904, 316]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[757, 326, 904, 340]]<|/det|>
1 hour 50 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[93, 384, 392, 399]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 213, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 96, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
Find the complex numbers \(z\) for which \(\frac{z + 5\mathrm{i}}{z - 5}\) is real and \(|z| = \sqrt{17}\) . Give your answers in the form \(z = x + \mathrm{i}y\) , where \(x\) and \(y\) are real.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 119]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 128, 920, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 430, 88]]<|/det|>
The parametric equations of a curve are

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 101, 594, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = \mathrm{e}^{\tan t},\quad y = 3\tan^{2}t.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 134, 918, 167]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the tangent to the curve at the point (e, 3). Give your answer in the form \(y = mx + c\), where \(m\) and \(c\) are exact. [6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 176, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 94, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 912, 95]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(3x^{3} + pax^{2} + 7a^{2}x + qa^{3}\) is denoted by \(\mathrm{f}(x)\), where \(p\), \(q\) and \(a\) are constants and \(a \neq 0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 106, 920, 141]]<|/det|>
When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((x + 2a)\) the remainder is \(-22a^{3}\) . When \(\mathrm{f}(x)\) is divided by \((3x - a)\) the remainder is \(-a^{3}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 154, 327, 173]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(p\) and \(q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 154, 920, 173]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 78, 94, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 78, 537, 100]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(z_{1} = 3\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{3}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) , \(z_{2} = \frac{3}{2}\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{6}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) and \(\omega = 2\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi \mathrm{i}}\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 110, 146, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 110, 918, 147]]<|/det|>
State the values of \(\omega z_{1}\) and \(\omega z_{2}\). Give your answers in the form \(r\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\theta}\), where \(r > 0\) and \(-\pi < \theta \leqslant \pi\). [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 312, 146, 330]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 312, 918, 348]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram with origin \(O\), show the points \(A\), \(B\), \(C\) and \(D\) representing the complex numbers \(z_1\), \(z_2\), \(\omega z_1\) and \(\omega z_2\) respectively. [2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 699, 144, 717]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 699, 611, 720]]<|/det|>
State the geometric effects of multiplying \(z_{1}\) and \(z_{2}\) by \(\omega\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 700, 920, 718]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 79, 97, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 79, 148, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 78, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
Express \(5\sin \left(x + \frac{1}{6}\pi\right) - 4\cos x\) in the form \(R\sin (x - \alpha)\) , where \(R > 0\) and \(0< \alpha < \frac{1}{2}\pi\) . State the exact value of \(R\) and give the value of \(\alpha\) correct to 3 decimal places. [4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 128, 917, 935]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 79, 918, 123]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(5\sin \left(2\theta + \frac{1}{6}\pi\right) - 4\cos 2\theta = \sqrt{7}\) for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant \pi\). Give your answers correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 101, 918, 120]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 73, 96, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 73, 917, 107]]<|/det|>
With respect to the origin \(O\) , the points \(A\) and \(B\) have position vectors \(2\mathbf{i} + 4\mathbf{k}\) and \(5\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 6\mathbf{k}\) respectively. The line \(l_{1}\) passes through the points \(A\) and \(B\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 146, 138]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 450, 138]]<|/det|>
Find a vector equation for the line \(l_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 148, 917, 500]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 507, 556, 526]]<|/det|>
The line \(l_{2}\) has equation \(\mathbf{r} = 2\mathbf{i} + \mathbf{j} + 5\mathbf{k} + \mu (\mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 3\mathbf{k})\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 539, 148, 556]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 539, 443, 556]]<|/det|>
Show that \(l_{1}\) and \(l_{2}\) do **not** intersect.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 539, 920, 556]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 567, 917, 932]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 81, 96, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 76, 460, 104]]<|/det|>
The constant \(a\) is such that \(\int_{1}^{a} 6x \ln x \, \mathrm{d}x = 4\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 125, 148, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 601, 158]]<|/det|>
Show that \(a = \exp\left(\frac{1}{6}\left(\frac{5}{a^2} + 3\right)\right)\), where \(\exp(x)\) denotes \(\mathrm{e}^x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 127, 920, 147]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 166, 917, 952]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 552, 88]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that \(a\) lies between 2 and 2.1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 72, 918, 90]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 103, 917, 432]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 444, 144, 460]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 444, 918, 476]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part (a) to determine \(a\) correct to 2 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 4 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 458, 918, 476]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 490, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 104, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 144, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 75, 763, 95]]<|/det|>
Find the quotient and remainder when \(x^{3} + 5x^{2} - 2x - 15\) is divided by \(x^{2} - 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 75, 920, 95]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 918, 500]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 510, 146, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 510, 571, 528]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(y\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[400, 546, 598, 585]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x} = \frac{x^3 + 5x^2 - 2x - 15}{6y(x^2 - 3)}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 602, 425, 621]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(y = 2\) when \(x = 2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 632, 737, 651]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation to obtain an expression for \(y^{2}\) in terms of \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 632, 920, 651]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 663, 918, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 102, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>11</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[361, 87, 631, 202]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 221, 918, 255]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve \(y = \cos x \sqrt{\sin 2x}\) for \(0 \leqslant x \leqslant \frac{1}{2}\pi\). The curve has a maximum point at \(M\), where \(x = a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 267, 146, 285]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 267, 356, 285]]<|/det|>
Find the exact value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 267, 918, 285]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 298, 918, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
The region enclosed between the \(x\)-axis and the curve is rotated through \(2\pi\) radians about the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 120, 510, 136]]<|/det|>
Find the exact volume of the solid generated.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 148, 918, 952]]<|/det|>
